name: I. Ivanovna N.
desc: A member of the Hexenzirkel and the first Mayor of Snezhnaya.

customize.name: Scarlett
customize.desc: Scarlett is the successor of I. Ivanovna N., as known as codename "J" of the Hexenzirkel.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>About J</color>
It may sound hard to believe, but I can attest to everything that Alice has said. J was also a mortal who aged and passed on, leaving her title to her students and followers.
I used to think that the Hexenzirkel was a group of women who could control the very fate of this world. But now... I've seen for myself that besides J, many other ordinary people were also among you.

customize.name: Alice
customize.desc: The Great Adventurer of the Realms, Dodo-King, Defender of Old Mondstadt, Friend of Adults Who Yet Harbor Hope, Author of the Teyvat Travel Guide, Originator of the Kujirai Art - Temari Jutsu, Supplier to the Renowned Lord Sangemah Bay, Elder and founder of the Hexenzirkel, Codename "A," Mother of Klee.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>About the letter with prophecy</color>
Ah, about that... Ehehe, I never expected anyone other than J to actually read the full contents of that prophecy. It's a little embarrassing...
The truth is, that prophecy was actually just a letter that we sent to J as a group the day before her wedding.
There was only one way the letter could have been interpreted. She would have known what we meant as soon as she saw the message. We were just asking one thing of her...
"Please come to see us again. Before you go and settle forever with your happiness, please come share some of it with your best friends and sisters."

customize.name: Hexenzirkel
customize.desc: A secret witch society, which discusses secrets at the tea parties and explores Irminsul. There are eight witches in the Hexenzirkel.

customize.text: I. Ivanovna N. was a member of the Hexenzirkel. Her codename was J.

customize.name: Alice
customize.desc: The Great Adventurer of the Realms, Dodo-King, Defender of Old Mondstadt, Friend of Adults Who Yet Harbor Hope, Author of the Teyvat Travel Guide, Originator of the Kujirai Art - Temari Jutsu, Supplier to the Renowned Lord Sangemah Bay, Elder and founder of the Hexenzirkel, Codename "A," Mother of Klee.

customize.name: Rhinedottir
customize.desc: An alchemist, a member of the Hexenzirkel, one of the five Sinners of Khaenri'ah, and Albedo's mother. Rhinedottir created an army of shadowy monsters, who attacked Teyvat 500 years ago. She's also known as Gold and R.

customize.name: Nicole
customize.desc: A prophetess and a member of the Hexenzirkel. She is also known as Nicole Reeyn and N. She is, presumably, one of the last seelies who remained conscious. She lost her voice and can only talk inside people's heads.

customize.name: Barbeloth
customize.desc: A visionary, a member of the Hexenzirkel, and Mona's teacher. She is also known as Astromancer Barbeloth Trismegistus and "B."

customize.name: Andersdotter
customize.desc: Anya M. Andersdotter was a mortal writer from Mondstadt and a member of the Hexenzirkel.

customize.name: Scarlett
customize.desc: Scarlett is the successor of I. Ivanovna N., as known as codename "J" of the Hexenzirkel.

customize.name: The Little Witch and the Undying Fire

customize.text: Story Teaser: The Mages' Tea Party

<color=#ffd780>March 7, 2023</color>
Upon receiving a message from the ancient lamp out of the blue, even the Great Adventurer of the Realms, Author of the Teyvat Travel Guide, Supplier to the Renowned Lord Sangemah Bay, Elder of the Hexenzirkel, Codename "A," Mother of the Most Adorable Klee — Alice was taken aback.
Fortunately, it was not a disastrous incident that had prompted the message. Instead, it served to bring back memories of companions whom she shared her youth with.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>

desc.text:
(Neat handwriting. This does not look like a fortune-telling slip...)
Barbie's gotten old, letting her emotions get in the way of proper writing. Not so I — as the first Mayor, I requested Alice to help me settle various trifling matters in Snezhnaya. And in exchange, she asked that I pen a passage in here.
I do not believe in any world after death, so we must live our best while we still draw breath. As such, I do not think you will read a word I write here — I write to myself alone.
Neither of us ever had any magic or combat training. We are simply ordinary. As such, we might be able to come to an understanding, though I believe otherwise. Alice was too ██ing good to you. Back in the day, she dragged me through waterways, blowing furnaces up, catching a cat within a Domain... The process was complicated and far from straightforward, but in any case, it was meant to protect the people around us.
You might have wondered, is this the price of getting along with this gaggle of mad women? I doubt you would agree with that assessment, nor would I. Those were, after all, the most precious days of our time together, were they not?
